Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget stay in Venice/Lido”
Reviews.Author: Sarah N
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location was perfect; a 10minute water bus to the center of Venice, and a small distance from Burano and Murano which are both beautiful islands well-worth a visit. Lowcostholidays.com helped us out by finding this hotel last minute, the hotel is surrounded by nice (decently priced) local bars and restaurants that don't feel touristy at all. The hotel staff were friendly and the breakfast was good. Nothing extravagant but for the price and convenience it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “No staff at the hotel, couldn't get in”
Reviews.Author: James V
Reviews.Content: Despite booking a hotel room and arriving at 3:50pm, I was unable to enter the locked hotel gates. Despite pressing the buzzer and calling the hotel multiple times, there was no answer. I could see inside that there was no-one at reception, and clearly no-one was monitoring their phone lines. I waited for over an hour, and after this booked another hotel. When I finally got in touch with Villa Edera, they were unwilling to cover any of the costs incurred in making such a late hotel booking. They were also quite rude and failed to appreciate the amount of time they had cost us between waiting for them + finding new accommodation, particularly given the limited time we had in Venice. I recommend not staying here, especially in winter, as the property is clearly not a priority for the owners. The front desk is also definitely NOT attended 24 hours as advised on booking.com - it was unattended the whole time I was waiting and even when I returned at 8pm I could only talk to someone via the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Cute,cosy,and very green.”
Reviews.Author: Gema L
Reviews.Content: The staff are ok. The hotel rooms are nice but they are bit small , however they have a very venetian character.The breakfast room is very sunny , and there is an outdoor garden with lovely hydrangeas.Lots of options in terms of food . Located 20 min away from the main station by a water taxi, and a 5 min walk from the beach on Lido which is an island off of the main Venice island.I highly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “room very small and shower tiny.Overated and overpriceed”
Reviews.Author: smplayareal
Reviews.Content: We paid extra to have the room at the top with a huge terrace...we contacted the hotel direct to do this. The room was really small and the you could barely move in the small bathroom,having a shower over the half a bath was nearly impossible. The airconditioing was very noisy and didnt really work so we had to leave the door open but then it was too noisy from outside.We could hear the delivery to to the supermarket each morning early even though it was on a different side to us ......it was not a restful stay and we would never stay here again. Some staff at reception were very helpful..Thomas I think his name was but the woman staff was bordering on rude.Breakfast was horrible..cheap cheese and ham and bread.

Reviews.Title: “Would give this one a miss”
Reviews.Author: CookieLancashire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and although the room was very clean it was so small that you could hardly move around the room. There was a tiny wardrobe which wasn't large enough to hold our clothes and there were no drawers so we had to leave everything in our cases on the floor. Our main concern was the breakfast. The choice available was ok but could have been better but it was the way the tables were left with dirty crockery and left-over food. The first morning we sat outside and there were several tables which hadn't been cleared so this was attracting pigeons which was pretty disgusting. We thought the next day would be better so we sat inside but it was the same again, dirty tables outside with pigeons and other birds on them and even inside the tables weren't cleaned as guests left the dining room and when other guests arrived for breakfast there was nowhere for them to sit and no clean cutlery or crockery. It was really disgraceful for a so called 3 star hotel. Also the coffee and hot water for the tea came in pots without lids so soon went cold. It was no better the last morning and the young waiter didn't seen to know what to do and just kept walking past the filthy tables without bothering clearing them. It was really disgusting and because of this we won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER to RETURN!”
Reviews.Author: TandLduo
Reviews.Content: If youâ€™re looking for a warm and friendly welcome, helpful staff you will not find it here at Villa Edera! In all my years of travel I have never come across Hotel Reception staff with such bad attitude. At the time of booking, I specifically asked for a room on an upper floor away from the kitchen, preferably with a balcony (as per the advice from a previous Trip Advisor review). We were staying for a 5 nights. The room we were allocated was on the ground floor and very near the kitchen. When I queried this on arrival I was told by Thomas, â€œit was a request only and they could not comply with my requestâ€� â€“ this line was repeated several times to me. He said there were no other rooms available, so basically it was just too badâ€¦ and with a shrug of his shoulders he said it â€œwas not possible to changeâ€� and this was the best he could do. (Villa Edera had several weeks to advise me, between making the reservation and our arrival, that they didnâ€™t have a suitable room). I did not feel comfortable with our allocated room at all. Safety being just one of the reasons due to the fact it had a handkerchief size patio on street side. We started to unpack - but then decided we would take a walk around the area to see if we could find an alternative Hotel. Within 15 minutes we found one. Hotel Le Boulevard. Cheaper, and with a bedroom twice the size, a rather large bathroom and with a water viewâ€¦ it was perfect, and the owners absolutely delightful. On returning to the Villa Edera 30 minutes later I told Thomas we would stay the first night but would vacate the following morning as we had found another Hotel that was only too happy to accommodate us. Thomas said that if we cancelled our booking he would take the FULL accommodation cost for the remaining 4 days off my Credit Card, so checking out was not an option. This guy is despicable. The interesting thing here is that all of a sudden he had two, yes two! alternative rooms to show us on the upper floor with balconies. Funny that! We changed roomsâ€¦ would much preferred to have changed Hotels though. The other two Reception staff members had a similar demeanour to Thomasâ€¦ guess it rubs off. Simonetta, is the Breakfast waitress, she is nicest thing about Villa Edera. Itâ€™s interesting to note that during our 5night stay, there were two other sets of Guests that werenâ€™t exactly happy with things at this Hotel either. Would I recommend this placeâ€¦ that would be a definite NO - never!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: haakon_bj
Reviews.Content: Bad: Rooms were small, breakfeast expensive, manager somewhat grumpy, wifi unstable, thin walls (we got waked up a few times by a kid next door crying) Good: Perfect location 5 min walk from the taxi boat to venice and 5 min walk to the beach, rooms clean and nice (although small), cheap (although we got the dumping rates at hotels.com at ~75â‚¬ pr room, I guess the full rates are somewhat higher), quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable hotel 10 minutes from Venice”
Reviews.Author: andreadic
Reviews.Content: Good points: good location in Venezia Lido near the public boat service to Venice, nice surroundings. Price seems too high but it is standard in Venice... Drawbacks: The room n. 21 was really incredibly noisy at morning, because it is near the kitchen. You have to wake-up 7 am anyway if you stay at the ground floor. Avoid rooms in the ground floor. Internet only if you pay extra.

Reviews.Title: “the owner places his porche cayenne before the entrance”
Reviews.Author: eric032
Reviews.Content: The owner places his porche every morning before the entrance. So you know that your money is spent very well. Our room was very small with 1 very small window of 1mÂ². We had a nice view on the super market. This was very noicy because they started at 6 o'clock with the suplly.The room was very dark, there was no terrace. I could get a room with a terrace for a surplus of 25 euro for 1 night. Also outside there is no seat for the guests. Every one has to stay in his room where you just have a bed. Breakfast is ok but if you want an omelette you have to pay 8 euro, an expresso coffee 3 euro... pay, pay.. pay...The bathroom is very small . The door of the shower is about 30 cm. My husband could not get in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Almost40Sheffield
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa Edera for three nights whilst visiting Venice and found the hotel welcoming and charming. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and made our stay a very pleasant one. The rooms whilst on the small side were tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean. The hotel's location on Lido made for a nice escape from the chaotic crowds on Venice itself. Lido has a lovely neighbourhood feel to it with the locals meeting up for Campari after work and it has several affordable pizzerias and nice speciality shops. Getting to and from the other Venetian islands is no problem with the waterbus stop a mere 5 mins walk from the hotel. I recommend buying a tourist pass as it is much cheaper than individual journey tickets. We would definitely stay at the Villa Edera again. My top tip is to visit Murano and see the glass blowers - amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory Stay”
Reviews.Author: mwcyen
Reviews.Content: Good location (Lido) if you like to stay at an area less crowded. Hotel is about 10 minutes walk from Lido vaporetto stop and half an hour vaparetto ride from Santa Lucia train station. Staff was helpful and friendly. Room was rather small though especially the bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: tejaztlana
Reviews.Content: Hotel Villa Edera was a nice find for our three-day stay in Venice. Since it's on Lido Island, It allowed us some distance between the crowds at San Marco but is close enough to get to everything easily by vaporetto. The hotel was very quaint, clean and comfy and our room had a nice terrace looking out onto the street where we could drink wine and watch people stroll or ride bikes around the neighborhood. The cafes in Lido were also a really nice place to have our morning coffee and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good price out of season”
Reviews.Author: liz28
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the Villa Edera for 5 nights and thought the price for a double room, 260 euro for the 5 nights was good, we had read reviews before going and people were saying to ask for the private room on the top floor with the huge balcony i did request this room and the hotel e mailed me to say i could reserve this room for a extra 30 euro a night, we decided as we may only visit Venice the once we would pay the extra, the room was a decent size by no means huge and the bathroom was also ok, was not to keen on the half bath/shower but served its purpose, the heating in the room was excellent and we needed it as cold this time of year in Venice,hotel staff were pleasant and the breakfast was also ok. We enjoyed staying on the Lido as it was so easy to visit all of Venice on the water boats, i looked up the water bus time table and printed off some time tables and routes and we visited Burano and found it so easy as i had all the information to hand, we also bought the 7 day venice card they do a 3 day also and found it was cheaper to buy the 7 day for our 5 day stay this includes all public transport to and from the airport and all water bus journeys whilst in Venice, We had a good holiday, weather was cold but no rain in the day. and not as expensive as i thought it may be.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Dierregi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend as possibly the best on the Lido, therefore I was maybe expecting too much (or maybe the other hotels are really a lot worse). Anyway, it has no parking so if you arrive by carry with the ferry from the Tronchetto, you can easily find some free parking in one of the little streets around it (to avoid paying â‚¬12 per day in the metered street). We were asked to pay the entire amount for our stay upon arrival, which I found strange and rather unpleasant. Our room was on the second floor and as mentioned by other people, was tiny, especially the bathroom. Besides, one of the bedside lamps was broken and badly re-assembled with cellotape (not a nice touch). The furniture was nicely decorate, but the wardrobe is so tiny that there was hardly place for some of our clothes, let alone to place the suitcase (even on top of it). Our room had two windows and we liked to keep them open, especially on arrival as there was a funny smell which however got away after the first day. Breakfast is OK and so are the receptionist and other personnel. The Lido itself is quite pleasant (nice beach) and to travel to Venice it is quite convenient to buy a whole-day (or two-day) ticket, which means you can travel around Venice and to the other islands as much as you want.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: crispy23
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here here before a few years ago we knew about the hotels excellent location on the Lido, very close to the beach & Vaporetto stop it makes an ideal base. On checking in we were aske to pay for the full cost of our stay up front which was a bit strange, they must have thought we looked the type that were going to do a runner! theystate that this is their normal policy. The receptionist was most unwelcoming and to the tune of being rude,we thought that it may have been us but during our stay overheard her talking in the same way to other poor guests, she is obviously in the wrong job. However every other member of staff we encountered were excellent including the house keeping ladies who kept the bedroom & public areas spotless. The room although small was clean but looking a bit tired and in need of some TLC, the shower was so small it was ridiculous. The breakfast was adequate, some mornings it was a bit chaotic with only one member of staff on duty she could not cope but tried her best. Overall we enjoyed our stay here again, it is a good base to explore Venice at a reasonable cost, but for a smallish hotel it seems to have lost the personal touch and it did not feel a friendly place any more.

Reviews.Title: “Good value basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: anothersuitcase
Reviews.Content: This is a nice enough place with great access to Venice. The water bus is 5 mins walk away and the beach about 10 mins. We stayed for 4 nights, the first night we were given room 38 which is a really tiny room with a really tiny double bed and not really any room to move around, we asked to be changed and the next day they moved us to a slightly bigger room 37. This was fine,room was just about big enough, but the bathroom is tiny and the showers are fine if you are small! Rooms are well furnished and the air con is great! Breakfast is OK but coffee was very slow coming on a couple of occasions, gets very busy from 9-00 until 9.30 (finish time) but really good if you happen to be around at 8.00! Staff are pretty good and tried to help out when they could. Chamber maids are kken, starting around 8.30 and often cleaning room while we were down for breakfast. I'd recommend the â‚¬20 for the beach access from the hotel if you fancy time on the beach, nice sandy beach with own sun shade and 2 sun beds - it's better value than hiring from the beach themselves. Beach area is nice and clean with a small cafe and clean loos. If you are taking the water bus from the airport to the Lido/city watch out for tickets. The 3 day ACTV city ticket (now â‚¬31) is not valid on the water bus to the city, you have to take the city bus and then water bus (nearly 2 hrs), or pay â‚¬12pp for the direct city service operated by a different company. Both are OK value but it does get expensive if not careful. The hotel is nice enough value for under â‚¬100 a night in a quiet area near everything you need, good find!.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Villa Edera”
Reviews.Author: Joepeanut
Reviews.Content: Lido is a quiter island compared to San Marco (15-20 mins by water boat from San Marco) and the food is much cheaper ie average 6Euros for a plate of pasta/pizza compared to 10Euros at San Marco. Transportation to the island is not a problem as the boat trips are regular even late in the night (72 hrs ticket for boats costs 30Euros and return bus to the airport for 9Euros). The Edera hotel is about 5 mins walk from the boat landing/pier, clean and modest. The room has AC/heating system, TV, hair dryer, safe deposit box but the only downside is that it hasn't got coffee/tea making facilities. The management doesn't encourage you to bring food/drinks to your room. The hotel is surrounded by cafes, restaurants, shops and even a supermarket called Billa (literally 2 mins walk away). Continental bfast is good with the usual toasts, croissants, cereals, eggs, cakes, ham and salami, juice & coffee/tea, rolls. There's always at least one receptionist staff on duty 24 hours so security is good. I would stay at the Edera Hotel because you save quite a bit on meals and accommodation (which includes bfast).

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay here again”
Reviews.Author: LisaP_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days and enjoyed every minute. Hotel friendly and spotlessly clean. Bedrooms are small but have everything you need. It was so nice to come 'home' to the peace of the Lido after busy days in Venice and on the boats! No building noise while we were there. The reception staff booked us concert seats instantly and with no extra charge. Good inexpensive restaurants nearby and we were directed to a great market on Tuesday and an excellent fish lunch at Malamocco. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for Venice”
Reviews.Author: RissesPieces
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Location - loved staying on the Lido away from tourist-frenzy of the main Venice islands, easy walk to vaporetto stop, close to shops but on a quiet street, inexpensive gelato (â‚¬1 single scoop) close by. 2. Breakfast - lovely buffet with friendly breakfast staff. Ham served on weekends. 3. Pleasant room. 4. The weekend front desk guy is excellent - he speaks perfect English. Cons: Building next door was undergoing renovations, so the noise got us up early and on our way...not that that was a bad thing. Other: Bathroom size was small, but expected. It was a lovely stay, and I'd definitely stay here again if I could get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: DoverKids
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Villa Edera in Sept/07. What a great location. We loved the close proximity to the shops, restaurants, beach, and vaporetto, while still being located on a quiet street. The rooms were small but they were comfortable and clean. The continental breakfast was good although the breakfast room was small and wasn't large enough for the number of guests. Consequently, people occasionally had a hard time finding a seat. Staff friendliness was hit or miss - we found some to be abrupt while others were very helpful and chatty. We did find it odd that we had to check our key at the front desk everytime we left the hotel (which we didn't encounter anywhere else on our 28 night trip) and were not given a clear answer as to why that policy existed. Overall, we had a great stay in Lido and would stay at this hotel again as it was a great value, a clean facility, and the location couldn't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Padare
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location on a quiet street centrally located on the Lido. However, the rooms are very basic, with small bathrooms. The hotel staff are not particularly friend either.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelersKaty
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Villa Edera in late June and loved it. The staff were very pleasant. Great breakfast buffet. I liked staying on the island of Lido, it was very quiet and a close walk to the beach. The vapoetta was a short distance to walk and it was not as busy at the main island of Venice. From here we traveled over to the island of Burano which was quite a treat. We were only here for 2 nights but this was one of our favorite stops on a three week journey. I wish our stay would have been longer and would recommend this hotel to anyone. The air conditioning was very refreshing and the room was small but charming and very clean..

Reviews.Title: “loved edera”
Reviews.Author: Molly005
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. Great spot on the Lido. It is just a few minutes walk to the Vapoetta The hotel is at the heart of everthing but still very quiet. The beach was just a pleasant walk away. The rooms were lovely, immaculately clean and what a blessing that air conditioning was! I would definitely recommend staying at the Edera in Lido to see Venice (just 10 minutes by Vaporetta to St Marks Square).

HotelInfo.Name: Villa Edera Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Negroponte, 13 | Lido of Venice, 30126 Venice, Italy
